net.heksemann.hexpdf

Class HexPDF

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument
      • net.heksemann.hexpdf.HexPDF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Pageable, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class HexPDF
extends org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument
    Simple class for generating pdf documents with support for tables and images, uses Apache pdfBox for basic pdf creation functions.

    The class adds automatic word wrap, left, right, center alignment of text, control over page borders, a simple table function with control over text alignment for each column, and inclusion of images in the document.

    Example usage

     
     HexPDF doc = new HexPDF();
  
     BufferedImage basemap = (your function for retrieving the image)
     BufferedImage overlay = (your function for retrieving the image)
     String title = "A simple pdf document";
     String exampleText = "Lorem ipsum dolor.......";

     Object[][] table = {
                          {"Country",  "Area", "Population", "Info"},
                          {"Norway",   "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Sweden",   "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Denmark",  "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Vietnam",  "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Thaland",  "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Burma",    "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"USA",      "col2", "col2", "col4"},
                          {"Germany",  "col2", "col2", "col4"}
                        };
 
     // Create the first page. IMPORTANT!
     doc.newPage();
 
     // Add a title
     doc.title1Style();
     doc.drawText("My simple document\n", HexPDF.CENTER);

     doc.normalStyle();
     doc.drawText(exampleText); // Default left aligned

     doc.drawImage(basemap, HexPDF.CENTER);
     doc.drawImage(overlay, HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.NEWLINE);
     doc.drawText("Figure 1: An example figure with overlay\n", HexPDF.CENTER);

     doc.drawText("\n\n" + exampleText, HexPDF.RIGHT);

     doc.drawTable(table,
                   new int[]{100, 50, 50, 300},
                   new int[]{HexPDF.LEFT, HexPDF.LEFT, HexPDF.LEFT, HexPDF.LEFT},
                   HexPDF.CENTER);
     doc.drawText("Table 1: Some countries I've been to\n", HexPDF.CENTER);

     doc.drawText("\n\n" + exampleText + exampleText, HexPDF.LEFT);

     doc.title1Style();
     doc.drawText("-- END OF DOCUMENT --", HexPDF.CENTER);

     doc.finish("myfile.pdf");

      • contentHeight

      • contentWidth

        protected float contentWidth
        The width, in points, of the writable area between left and right margins

      • contentStartX

        protected float contentStartX
        The starting (leftmost, lowest value) x position of writable area. Equal to leftMargin

      • contentStartY

        protected float contentStartY
        The starting (topmost, highest value) y position of writable area. Equal to bottomMargin + contentHeight

      • contentEndX

        protected float contentEndX
        The end (rightmost, highest value) x position of writable area. Equal to leftMargin + contentWidth

      • contentEndY

        protected float contentEndY
        The end (bottommost, lowest value) y position of writable area. Equal to bottomMargin

      • cursorX

        protected float cursorX
        The x-position in points of the current cursor position.

      • cursorY

        protected float cursorY
        The y-position in points of the current cursor position. Note that y values are increasing towards the top of the page in pdf.

      • _drawText

        protected float _drawText(java.lang.String txt,
                          float startx,
                          float endx,
                          int flags)
        Draw a text from the current cursor position. The text can be multi-line and even multi-page. When crossing page boundaries (contentEndY) a new page is created. Newline characters force explicit lineshift. Normal word-wrap is performed to keep the text between the stated boundaries startx and endx
        Parameters:
        txt - The text to be drawn
        startx - Left edge of area available for drawing
        endx - Right edge of area available for drawing
        flags - One of HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT | HexPDF.JUSTIFY for text alignment between startx and endx
        Returns:
        Actual height of the string drawn
        See Also:
        drawText(java.lang.String, int), drawText(java.lang.String, float, float, int)

      • drawText

        public float drawText(java.lang.String txt,
                      int flags)
        Draw a text from the current cursor position. The text can be multi-line and even multi-page. When crossing page boundaries (contentEndY) a new page is automatically created. Newline characters force explicit lineshift. Normal word-wrap is performed to keep the text between the current leftMargin and rightMargin
        Parameters:
        txt - The text to be drawn
        flags - One of HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT | HexPDF.JUSTIFY for text alignment between startx and endx
        Returns:
        Actual height of the string drawn
        See Also:
        drawText(java.lang.String, float, float, int), _drawText(java.lang.String, float, float, int)

      • drawText

        public float drawText(java.lang.String txt)
        Draw a left-aligned text from the current cursor position. The text can be multi-line and even multi-page. When crossing page boundaries (contentEndY) a new page is automatically created. Newline characters force explicit lineshift. Normal word-wrap is performed to keep the text between the current leftMargin and rightMargin
        Parameters:
        txt - The text to be drawn
        Returns:
        height of text drawn
        See Also:
        drawText(java.lang.String, int), _drawText(java.lang.String, float, float, int)

      • drawText

        public float drawText(java.lang.String txt,
                      float x,
                      float y,
                      int flags)
        Draw a text from the specified position. The text can be multi-line and even multi-page. When crossing page boundaries (contentEndY) a new page is automatically created. Newline characters force explicit lineshift. Normal word-wrap is performed to keep the text between the current leftMargin and rightMargin
        Parameters:
        txt - The text to be drawn
        x - Starting x-position for the text
        y - Starting y-position for the text
        flags - One of HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT | HexPDF.JUSTIFY for text alignment between startx and endx
        Returns:
        Actual height of the string drawn
        See Also:
        drawText(java.lang.String, int), _drawText(java.lang.String, float, float, int)

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                      int flags)
        Draw an image starting at current cursor location. If no flags are given, the top-left corner of the image is positioned at the current cursor position. If one of the flags HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT is set, the image is adjusted between leftMargin, rightMargin accordingly. The cursor location is kept unchanged unless the flag HexPDF.NEWLINE is set. This is useful for adding pictures as layers. If HexPDF.NEWLINE is set, the cursor is positioned at leftMargin immediately below the image.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be added
        flags - see description

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                      float x,
                      float y,
                      int flags)
        Draw an image at the given location. If no flags are given, the top-left corner of the image is positioned at the specified x, y location. If one of the flags HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT is set, the image is adjusted horizontally between leftMargin, rightMargin accordingly. The top of the image will always be at the given y position. The cursor location is kept unchanged unless the flag HexPDF.NEWLINE is set. This is useful for adding pictures as layers. If HexPDF.NEWLINE is set, the cursor is positioned at leftMargin immediately below the image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to be added
        x - wanted x-value of image top-left corner on the page
        y - wanted y-value of image top-left corner on the page
        flags - see description

      • drawTable

        public float drawTable(java.lang.Object[][] table,
                       float[] column_width,
                       int[] column_flag,
                       int table_align)
        Add a table to the document starting at current cursor location. The input table must be a two-dimensional array of Object, all rows must have the same number of columns. If the table extends beyond the page boundary contentEndY a new page is automatically created and the table continues. Normal word-wrap is performed within each cell if the text is longer than the column designated width. A table element (Object) can be either a String or a BufferedImage
        Parameters:
        table - the table data. Objects should be String or BufferedImage
        column_width - array of column widths
        column_flag - array of flags for text alignment within columns, one of HexPDF.LEFT | HexPDF.CENTER | HexPDF.RIGHT
        table_align - flag for alignment of the table itself
        Returns:
        the height of the table - if multipage then return the height on the last page.

      • getPDPageContentStream

        public org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.edit.PDPageContentStream getPDPageContentStream()
        Returns the underlying PDPageContentStream from pdfBox. Note that the PDPageContentStream will change whenever a new page is created, it is hence important to call getPDPageContentStream() before any direct operation on the content stream.
        Returns:
        PDPageContentStream in use

      • setPageSize

        public void setPageSize(org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.common.PDRectangle pageSize)
        Set page size to be used. Takes effect on the next explicit or automatic newPage() Default is PDPage.PAGE_SIZE_A4
        Parameters:
